meanings.definition: An act or strategy in response to a previous move.
meanings.sent1: After his opponent's attack, he quickly planned a countermove to defend himself.
meanings.sent2: In chess, a player must always be prepared with a countermove to respond to the opponent's tactics.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's countermove was so unexpected that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to invest in the stock market was like a well-calculated countermove in a game of financial chess.
meanings.sent5: The countermove in the game was so strategic that it became the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: To make a move in response to an opponent's move.
meanings.sent1: She had to countermove quickly to block her opponent's attack.
meanings.sent2: When playing tennis, it is essential to countermove effectively after your opponent serves.
meanings.sent3: The cat countermoved by jumping out of the way when the dog tried to pounce.
meanings.sent4: His decision to countermove by offering a compromise surprised everyone in the negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful countermove in the routine captivated the audience.
